text: Gave closing remarks for our Student Leadership Summit. My message: Think big and big things will happen! #2015SLS http://t.co/Qd3RT2a3jN
label: R

text: Megan: "Find groups with your passions. Fine organizations with values that align with yours." #2015SLS
label: R

text: Student question to panel: "What are good ways to meet people in college?" #2015SLS
label: R

text: Jalen: "I immediately got involved to establish roots in my home away from home." #2015SLS
label: R

text: Megan: "Mom was sad. We created a plan to talk on the phone or text on a regular basis. Establish that communication plan." #2015SLS
label: R

text: Joslyn: "I got very involved in college groups to keep my mind off missing my family. I'm always staying busy." #2015SLS
label: R

text: My question to the panel: Talk about your first month of college. Emotionally being away from family or overwhelmed. #2015SLS
label: R

text: Jalen: "It's not always about learning. It's about learning to learn." #2015SLS
label: R

text: Jalen: "I found it helpful to set goals. Both long term and short term." #2015SLS
label: R

text: Question to panel: "What are some exercises or anything to help with the workload I'll have in college?" #2015SLS
label: R

text: Question to panel: "How did you prioritize things in college?" Megan: "Follow your passions and dreams & join clubs you enjoy. #2015SLS
label: R

text: Advice to students from Jalen: "My biggest piece of advice is to accept responsibility." #2015SLS
label: R

text: Advice to students from Megan: "Use the personal connections you make to help you in college. Building relationships is important." #2015SLS
label: R

text: Advice to students from Joslyn: "Take criticism and use it to better yourself." #2015SLS
label: R

text: Advice to students from Hunter: "Humility is the #1 leadership skill I recommend. It has gotten me pretty far in life so far." #2015SLS
label: R

text: (2/2) "...Use that to improve your understanding of situations to better explain them to others." @purduemitch  #2015SLS

text: (1/2) "No matter how prepared you are, there will always be criticism..." #2015SLS

text: "Yes. It's always important to listen to criticism because an argument might arise that you never thought of." @purduemitch #2015SLS
label: R

text: Student question to @purduemitch: "Did criticism ever sway a decision?" #2015SLS
label: R

text: "We have to be a state who is lead by people who won't settle." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
label: R

text: .@purduemitch: "Keep moving forward. Don't settle for middle of the road. Look for new things that will make us a stronger, better state."
label: R

text: Student question to @purduemitch: "200 years of statehood. What can we do for the next 200 years to move forward?" #2015SLS
label: R

text: .@purduemitch on Churchill: "Remarkable combination. He never quit studying, had immense courage, and never stopped learning." #2015SLS
label: R

text: Student question to @purduemitch: "Who have you worked with or studied that is the best leader?" Answer: "Winston Churchill." #2015SLS
label: R

text: (2/2) "...They will contact you. You don't have to go brag on it. Your most valuable contacts will find you." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
label: R

text: (1/2) "I didn't seek out mentors as much as I should have. The best way to make contacts is to do a good job..." #2015SLS
label: R

text: Student question to @purduemitch: "How did you make connections?" #2015SLS
label: R

text: (2/2) "...you will learn so much from that, that it might position you for future success." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
label: R

text: (1/2) "I like trying different things. If you're willing, when an opportunity knocks..." #2015SLS
label: R

text: "Greater gratification comes in the form of results." - @purduemitch  #2015SLS
label: R

text: Student question to @purduemitch: "What's your biggest motivation?" #2015SLS
label: R

text: (2/2) "I try to concentrate on things that didn't go well. You're human. There's a lesson to be learned." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
label: R

text: (1/2) "I try not to dwell on the things that went well. I'm happy and fulfilled..." #2015SLS
label: R

text: Question: "You've accomplished a lot. What is your biggest success?" #2015SLS
label: R

text: .@purduemitch now taking questions from students. #2015SLS http://t.co/CqrYgD9UOB
label: R

text: "I didn't find 'oops' to be a hard word to say. I failed & made mistakes. You have to be prepared for the things that don't go your way."
label: R

text: "The right decision won't always be 100% clear. You have to learn to take chances." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
label: R

text: "Don't ask people to work harder than you. Don't ask them to do things you yourself wouldn't do." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
label: R

text: .@purduemitch on integrity and character: "People will not follow someone they don't trust. Tell. The. Truth." #2015SLS
label: R

text: "Read bios of great leaders and one day you might face the same challenge. You can take from that knowledge." - @purduemitch #2015SLS
label: R

text: .@purduemitch says learn from other leaders. "Share their formulas for success and learn from their mistakes and failures." #2015SLS
label: R

"English, math, science,
history. If you want to be a leader there is no way to do so w/o a basic knowledge of those fields." #2015SLS
